intro: Psychotria plusiantha, commonly known as the Plusiantha Psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. The plant's botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
